findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract code which may lead to confusion and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Right-To-Left- Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The presence of U+202E control characters can lead to User Interface (UI) Misrepresentation of Critical Information

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
Write to Arbitrary Storage Location
findings.description: The contract allows writing to arbitrary storage locations, which can lead to unauthorized data manipulation and potential security risks.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: Improper Following of Specification by Caller

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
findings.description: The contract does not properly verify cryptographic signatures, making it vulnerable to signature replay attacks.

findings.title: Weak Sources of Randomness from Chain Attributes
findings.description: The contract uses chain attributes such as block.timestamp or block.number as a source of randomness, which can be manipulated by miners and is therefore insecure.

findings.title: Incorrect Constructor Name
findings.description: The constructor function has an incorrect name which can lead to unexpected behavior.
